So Matth. iii. 8, Bring forth fruits WORTHY of repentance, i. e. according with and befitting‚ not repugnant to the repentance which ye profess. He, therefore, walks worthy of God who flees from the base- ness and folly of carnal men, who carries himself as a faithful soul, loving God and his brethren, although he often slides and sins through infirmity. For this our worthi- ness does not depend upon our absolute perfection‚ but upon the gratuitous condescension of God, who accounts, as worthy his favour, those who follow the guidance ofhis spirit; and those unworthy who yield themselves slaves to the flesh and sin.
